intro: Hibbertia synandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in regions of Queensland and New South Wales. Hibbertia synandra has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
